intro: Werauhia insignis var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved werauhia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and rosette-forming leaves that are short and broad. The inflorescence consists of showy, colorful bracts that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories.
